meanings.definition: The state or quality of being final.
meanings.sent1: The finality of the decision left no room for further discussion.
meanings.sent2: The judge's ruling brought a sense of finality to the case.
meanings.sent3: The finality of the test results made everyone gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The finality of the sunset marked the end of a beautiful day.
meanings.sent5: The finality of the lock clicking shut signaled the end of the day.

meanings.definition: The condition of being complete and unable to be changed.
meanings.sent1: The finality of the contract meant no more negotiations could take place.
meanings.sent2: The finality of the decision brought a sense of closure to the situation.
meanings.sent3: The finality of the puzzle being solved brought cheers from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The finality of the mountain peak in the distance was a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent5: The finality of the last piece fitting perfectly into place was satisfying.

meanings.definition: The conclusiveness or decisiveness of something.
meanings.sent1: The finality of the referee's call ended the game.
meanings.sent2: The finality of the verdict put an end to the trial.
meanings.sent3: The finality of the cat catching the mouse was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The finality of the thunderstorm clearing the sky was a relief.
meanings.sent5: The finality of the applause signaled the success of the performance.
